alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Muscatine; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 9:48AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cedar, southern Johnson, northeastern Washington and northern Muscatine Counties through 1030 AM CDT... At 947 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Heights, or over Iowa City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Iowa City, Muscatine, Tipton, West Branch, Durant, Coralville, North Liberty, West Liberty, Wilton, Kalona, Tiffin, Lone Tree, University Heights, Riverside, Lowden, Hills, Bennett, Nichols, Atalissa and Rochester. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 236 and 277. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
